1.content: What gender is the person gonna be?
1.title: What gender  is the person gonna be?

11.content: What age is the Male/boy gonna be?
11.title: Male

111.content:
A 10 year old boy named John wandered into the clothing storing. He looked around, and wondered why he had come in. He wasn't really looking for anything inparticular, and in fact hated clothes shopping. But he was just wandering around and when he had seen the store, he had just felt like going in there, almost as if he was drawn to it.

With a shrug, he decided to walk arond it for a bit. Normally, he would want to leave a place like this as soon as possible, but had thought about that this time. As he walked down the aisles, his hand accidentally brushed against a piece of clothing. And unfortnately for him, that was all that it would take to innitiate the change that he would soon experience.


What kind of clothing did he touch?
111.title: Kid 1 to 12 years old

choices: The clothes are made for his body(No physical changes at all)
His body transforms to match his new clothes(Gender and age change)
1111.content:
As John continued to walk, he suddenlt felt something strange come over him for a moment, and then it quickly passed. But even so, he still felt like something was off, and he felt slightly taller. When he looked down, he quickly noticed why.

John was now wearing a crisp, white, womens blouse, and from his waist was a short, tight, black skirt that came down to mid-thigh. A pair of shiny, black pantyhose were on his legs and a pair of two inch tall pumps were on his feet. And underneath those, he had also gotten a lacy bra that he now wore underneath, and underneath his new skirt was a matching pair of panties. A purse was even slung over his shoulder. He was now dressed in women's clothes!
1111.title: A woman's blouse and skirt

choices: John leaves the store as quickly as he can
11111.content:
"Wh-what just happened!?" John let out, shocked by what had just happened to him. One second he was dressed normally, and the next moment he was dressed in women's clothes! Though strangely enough, the clothes looked like something for a grown woman, but fit his young, male body perfectly. The bra's cups even fit his flat, boy chest perfectly.

John was confused and worried by what had happened, wondered what he should do.
11111.title: The clothes are made for his body

choices: John leaves the store as quickly as he can, and runs home
John feels like he should be somewhere else, and leaves the store
111111.content:
John wondered what he should do, and decided that he should check the purse that was hanging from his shoulder. As he looked arond inside of it, he found a variety of things. Among them were make up(Which he wasn't aware yet, but was currently applied to face), a compact mirror, some money and debit cards, a phone, and a driver's license. Looking at the license, he was even more shocked by what he saw. It was his picture on it! But in the picture, while it was his body, he could see that he was wearing women's clothes, seeing that he was wearing a white blose like the one he currently wore, and saw that his face had make up on in it. Another odd thing about it was that it had all of his information on it, including his name and age, even though there should be no concievable way that a 10 year old should be able to get a driver's license. As he put the license back into the purse, he saw there was even a set of keys in the purse, one of which was definitely for a car.

"What is going on here?" John wondered aloud worriedly.
111111.title: John checks the purse

choices: He notices that the rest of his room now resembles a grown woman's room
Mom comes in to talk(Is aware he is her son, but now treats him like a woman)
1111111.content:
In a panic, John knows he doesn't want to be in this crazy store any longer. As quickly as he can, he heads towards the exit. As he does, he doesn't realize that he doesn't have any problem walking in the pumps, even though he has never worn shoes with heels before in his life. In fact, he seemed to unconciously know how fast he could move in them and the skirt without tripping.

As he left the store, he quickly made his way home to get changed, not even realizing that people would see him on his way there, and he didn't pay attention to any he passed. But as he passed them, they didn't pay much attention to him either, not finding the sight of a 10 year old boy dressed like a women to be strange.

When he got home, he noticed that there was an unfammiliar car in the driveway, but didn't have time to wory about it. He then ran upstairs to his room, and when he got there he was relieved. He'd be able to get out of these clothes and into something else. But his hopes were quickly dashed as he opened his closet and instead of his own stuff he saw clothes similar to what he was wearing. Checking his dresser drawers yielded the same result. All of his clothes had been replaced with women's clothes, all of which was made to fit a 10 year old boy instead of a grown woman.
1111111.title: John leaves the store as quickly as he can, and...

choices: He makes a call to a friend
11111111.content:
"What the heck?" asked John as he got a better look at his room.

Looking around, he saw that his room didn't resemble the usual 10 year old boy's room anymore. Aside from seeing that his closet was full of woman's clothes now, everything else was radically different. His bed was bigger now, not too large but definately made for an adult. Places were his toys and such were gone now, ;eaving lots more empty space than there was before.

There was a new desktop, with a labtop sitting on top of it. The walls were no longer colored, now being a normal peach kind of color.On top of his dresser was what seemed to be some pieces of jewelry, with a make-up case sitting with them. Along the wall, thaks to the empty space, a vanity set was now placed, with a large mirror fit for an adult woman. Simply put, there was nothing kiddish left.

"What is going on? Why are these clothes sticking to me and changing everything?" wondered John. His 10-year old mind couldn't really comprehend just what was going on right now.

Then, what happened?
11111111.title: He notices that the rest of his room now resemb...

111111111.content:
Suddenly, John's mom came into his "room", looking as cheery as ever.

"Hello John." said Ellen, his mom.

"Mom, what's going on?" asked John, trying to get some answers.

"What do you mean?" asked Ellen, obviously not really knowing any difference in the situation.

"Why dos my room look like this? And these clothes just won't come off." said John, trying to get through to her.

"What are you talking about? That's your usual business uniform. Speaking of which, I needed to tell you something." said Ellen.

"What?" asked John as plainly as he could.

What does Ellen tell him?
111111111.title: His mom comes in

1111111112.content: Who is the call from?
1111111112.title: John has a call waiting

11111111121.content:
"You have a call waiting from your husband," says John's mother, as if there's nothing weird about it at all.

"HUSBAND?!" exclaims John, in disbelief, his mind now raising question after question as his mother speaks again.

"Yes, your husband. What's so confusing about that?" says his mother, rather baffled at his outburst.

John is too head-rattled to question any more without some time to think about this more, "N-nothing… I just… I'm not 'myself' today," he says, dismissing the conversation.

"Alright then. Hurry up and take the call before he hangs up."

John slowly walks downstairs, despite his mother's warning, still trying to make the most sense out of his situation that he can. Upon reaching the phone, he picks it up and answers it, "Hello…?"

Who is it on the other line that just so happens to be his "husband"?
11111111121.title: His "husband"

choices: a wedding ring appearing on his finger
111111111212.content:
"Hello honey, how are you at Ellen's place?" asked the voice.

It was Donald Somers, who was actually the boss of John's dad. This came as a huge shock, as John wondered why he would talk to him like this.

"Um...I'm okay." said John, really nervous right now. Donald didn't seem to catch that though.

"That's good. I need to ask you something." he went on to say.

"What's that?" asked John.

"I'm a little busy today, but you should have the time to do some errands. I can e-mail it to you, but it's just a couple things. Think you can work that into your schedule, along with your trip to the mall later?" he asked.

"Trip to the mall?" thought John, becoming more confused, but he needed to answer Donald.

"Um, sure. I guess." said John.

"Thanks honey. I'll see you at home. Love you." he said before hanging up. John couldn't have felt more confused than he did at that moment.

"Why did he talk to me like that? I'm just a kid." said John to himself. He was only a kid, not even a teenager yet, and he really didn't understand all of this.

Suddenly, John felt a little tingle go through him, to which he felt.....
111111111212.title: His father's boss

choices: Get a haircut (resulting in quite the opposite)
1111111112121.content:
John felt something odd on his finger as he set the phone down. He shook his hand a couple of times before he finally looked down at it and saw that there was a big wedding ring firmly on it. He might have taken it off right away, but there was something about it that made him want to leave it on, almost as if it were important to him somehow.

"This can't be real… what am I feeling… what am I SEEING?!" John thought as he stared at the ring. He stood there a while longer, just staring and thinking, struggling to understand with his 10 year old brain.

Just then, his mother came out again, snapping him out of his daze. "Is something wrong? You've been standing there for quite a while now," she said to him, but her tone sounded different; it was less like she was talking to her son, and more like one of her own friends.

"I'm… I'm fine, Mom," said John, too lost in his thoughts to notice much.

"Call me Ellen, please," his mom said as if John had addressed her by her last name.

"Um, okay… Ellen…" John said, even more confused.

"So, what did Donald want, if you don't mind me asking?" Ellen asked, considerately.

"He… he wants me to pick up some things on my… trip to the mall later…" said John, still not sure about all this.

"Well, lemme make you some lunch before you go. Don't try to be humble now, I insist! I won't take no for an answer," Ellen said, like it was some sort of special treat.

"Okay…" answered John slowly.

After he had finished his meal, John went back to "his" room and sat down at the desk inside. He lifted the lid on the laptop and found it was already on, but locked. He wondered for a minute why he even sat down at this computer because it definitely did not belong to him, despite it being in his room.

Suddenly, he began to type something. As he did, he could feel the ring on his finger, which seemed to fit him perfectly, just like the rest of his clothes. He pressed enter and the computer logged on. John was too busy observing to wonder how he could have known the password. He really didn't use computers much, and didn't even have an email address. Nevertheless, he began to operate the machine as if he had been using it for years.

He somehow knew exactly where everything was. He opened his mail and looked at the email Donald sent. "Okay. I can handle that," a few words escaped from John's mouth, who was unsure where exactly they came from. He printed the list like a pro and stuffed it into his purse.

If he had looked back after leaving his room, he would have found that it had vanished, but it was not gone from reality completely. A few miles away, in Donald's house, the master bedroom beginning to get larger.

As if in a daze, he made his way to the door and called out a "goodbye" to Ellen. "Come back soon, Amanda," she answered from the other room as John stepped out the door.

"Amanda?! Was she actually talking to me…?" John thought as he stepped into his car mindless of how odd it really was for him to even own a car. He sat down in the driver's seat and found that he could reach everything perfectly, despite being only 10 years old and still using a booster seat. It was almost as if the car was smaller on the inside than on the outside.

Regardless, he took the keys out of his purse and started it up. He had absolutely no idea how to drive, or where the mall was, yet somehow he managed to pull it off without the slightest problem. No one found it odd to see a such a young boy driving, and some of the men even gave him looks which seemed to be complimentary, but made him feel quite uncomfortable.

While he was driving, John felt a sudden urge to check on his makeup. At the next red light, he began to apply more to his face. "I have to look my best in public," he said aloud, but wasn't sure why he said it.

When he reached the mall, he got out of his car, locked the door, and began to walk toward the door, haphazardly swaying his hips as he did so. He wondered just why he was here, other than to pick up the items on the list, and wasn't sure which store he should go to first, but as he was thinking, his legs made up his mind for him.

He first was going to…
1111111112121.title: a wedding ring appearing on his finger

11111111121211.content:
John's legs seemed to have a mind of their own, walking through the mall. To John's surprise, no one seemed to find him wierd at all, being a 10-year old boy wearing women's clothing.

"Why does no one find this wierd?" he asked himself.

In addition, he was curious as to how these heels were feeling so much more comfortable now. Perhaps it was because he was walking in them more often or something.

Anyway, as if on autopilot, he continued on his way. Eventually, as he walked through, he came to one of the items on his list. It mentioned something along the lines of getting a haircut. Raising an eyebrow, he put a hand to his head.

"Wierd. My hair doesn't feel long enough for a haircut." he said.

Regardless, he found his way to a Great Clips store inside the mall, where he just walked in casually. He concluded that he might as well see this through. Nothing might happen since his hair was short. As he walked in, one woman saw him and smiled.

"Hello Amanda! Back for your usual?" she asked, still smiling.

"Usual?" John asked himself. There was that "Amanda" line again.

"Yep, got you down for your usual at this time. Why don't you come back and we can get you going? You're just on time as usual." said the lady.

"Um, thanks Mrs..." started John, but he didn't know the woman's name.

"Carol. You know that I don't need to be called Mrs. We're friends after all." said Carol.

That confused John even more. He never met her before, so why would she say that? Anyway, Carol grabbed his hand, leading him to the back where she would apparently work on him.

"What's she going to do with me not having much hair anyway?" thought John.

If only he knew.
11111111121211.title: Get a haircut (resulting in quite the opposite)

choices: He suddenly needs to use the bathroom
111111111212111.content:
"Have a seat!" Carol said lively.

As if out of habit, John sat down in the chair and leaned his his head back into the "sink". Carol then turned on the water and began to wash his hair with soap. John had to admit, it felt good as she massaged his head with the soap, but something also felt off, as if his hair was becoming… looser.

"Alright Amanda, let's get started!" said Carol.

"Again with that?" John thought, but he decided not to question it for now. Carol sat him up and took him by the hand once again, directing him towards her normal station.

"Now then, let's give you some color!" said Carol getting out her dyes.

"Color?!" asked John, perplexed.

"Yes, color. You know, hair dye." Before John could protest, Carol quickly applied the dye to his hair, changing it to a nice light-brown color.

"Now, for the styling!" said Carol. John wasn't sure what she was doing at first, but he felt her tug at his loosened-up hair. However, it didn't just come out completely, but it began to grow longer as she pulled. "What are you doing?!" John wanted to say, but the words only reached his lips, then vanished into nothingness.

After his hair had become a considerable length, Carol put it into a ponytail and showed John his reflection in the mirror. He was utterly shocked. Between the makeup and his new hairdo, he practically looked like a complete woman! He also noticed that although the dye was used before his hair grew, the new hair was still the same color as the dyed hair.

"No need to pay me, this one's on the house!" Carol said.

"Thank you…" said John. This day is just one confusion after the other.

John then left the store and was deciding where to go next. Once more, his body made up his mind for him.

He was headed to…
111111111212111.title: A new hairdo

1111111112121111.content:
John's legs continued to walk on their own pretty much, making up his mind for him. Meanwhile, John couldn't wrap his head over what was happening. First the clothes, now he had the make up and long hair. Kind of reminded him of his mom.

Then, of course, there was the wedding ring.

"What is going on here?" asked John, wishing he knew what was happening to him.

Anyway, he walked along the huge mall, avoiding any other shoppers. Soon enough, a large JC Penny loomed overhead, which John knew to be a clothes store.

"Why am I here?" asked John.

He knew that he didn't really need any new clothes, so why would he come here. Of course, almost this whole day has gone against what he would usually do. Still on autopilot, John walked through the entrance and into the store itself. One of the cashiers there smiled at him.

"Hello Amanda. Looking for a new bra? Might be time." she smiled.

"Bra? What does she mean?" asked John to himself as he passed her by, gently waving at her.

Honestly, he didn't really know much about a bra, other than his mom wore them. He was only 10 years old after all.

Anyway, with all this going on, he wound up in...
1111111112121111.title: The dress shop

11111111121211111.content:
After a bit of auto-pilot walking, John looked around and, sure enough, there were bras on display all around him. As he gazed around, the atmosphere of the place began to remind him of that one other clothing store where this whole mess had gotten started.

As he examined the different bras, he began to wonder just what was it about them that drew his attention so much. It wasn't like he was about to buy one or anything…

In an instant, all those thoughts left his mind as he saw something that made him stop in place. There, on the shelf, was just what he needed. A large, size DD bra. He picked up a few and left the area, feeling a large sense of accomplishment that was soon replaced by confusion as his legs carried him to his next destination.
11111111121211111.title: the bra section

choices: He walks and sees a mirror
111111111212111111.content:
"DD? Why did I grab this?" asked John to himself.

Despite his changes, the boy still had the mind of a 10-year old for the most part. The kid hardly understand what bras were or what they were for. All he knew is that he needed one for some reason and now he had quite a few of them bought. He knew he was wearing a bra currently, although it would be a while before it would serve its purpose.

"Well, what's next then?" wondered John.

Checking his list, it then said for him to get some panties. Again, the term was unfamiliar to him. However, his legs seemed to carry him forward, going towards a section he previously thought was an underwear section.

However, after some time, his body went through the motions of getting some panties, as he examined the undergarments, although he couldn't figure out why.

"These are pretty, but why do I need them?" asked John to himself.

However, just like before, he ended up buying a few sets of panties, many of them different colors.

"Am I done?" he asked himself.
111111111212111111.title: The panty section

choices: His legs carried him to another store.
He needed to use the bathroom.
1111111112121111111.content:
Finally, John realized he had control over his legs again. However, now he had no idea where to go. He strolled around the store a bit, trying to find the exit, when suddenly he passed by a mirror. Without really paying attention to the situation, John began to examine himself, feeling along his sides and realizing that something felt off.

"Wait… what am I doing…? Of course there's nothing wrong with me!"

Even still, he stood there a while longer. Suddenly, he realized that he hasn't had a chance to try on his new undergarments yet. He suddenly got an urge to find a dressing room, and somehow did so without much trouble.

He felt himself step inside and strip off his clothes, which finally let themselves come off. Partially on auto-pilot again, he began to pull up a pair of his new panties. Next he slipped into one of his huge new bras.

Once again, he began to examine himself in the mirror, only this time within the dressing room stall. He realized something still felt off, that is, until he moved his hands to his butt.

As he felt it, he realized that it was a bit… squishier. He sat down on it and realized that it was much more comfortable now, and he felt it inflating even more.

"What the heck…?!" John said as he felt his butt finish expanding, filling out the panties. Then he felt something in his chest. He put his hands on his new bra, and sure enough, there was something underneath. "No…" he said as two tiny mounds began to grow in his hands. He tried to squish them back in, but to no avail. They continued to grow and he was getting worried.

He tried ripping the bra off, but that didn't help. They just kept getting bigger and bigger, already at A cups. He tried once more to press them back into his chest, but instead received a warm pleasureful feeling that made him moan. He had never felt anything like it, being only 10 years old.

John's new breasts now reached C cups, having been sped up by his pressing on them. At this point, all he could do was watch as they continued to expand. They grew through D and finally reached size DD where they stopped. John stared at the enormous mounds for a while, wondering what he was going to do. Suddenly, he felt his body act for him again. He put on the large bra, now fully filled out, and put his clothes back on overtop, which still seemed to fit perfectly, despite his altered proportions. Finally, he gathered up his old bra and panties as well as his other things and left the dressing room.

As he walked, he felt his hips swaying. He tried to walk normally, but between his butt and the heels, he simply couldn't. He was hoping this nightmare was almost over when…
1111111112121111111.title: He walks and sees a mirror

11111111121211111111.content:
To the world, John must have looked bizarre. Here was someone only 10 years old, yet having the assets of an older woman. It looked even more bizarre with the fact that he still had the same size as a 10-year old. John's mind was going crazy right now, not knowing what to do.

"What is happening?! What are these things on my chest?! They're like mommys." he said to himself as he continued walking.

As he walked along, his legs were taking him towards yet another store. As he was thinking, he looked up and saw a sign.

"A jewelry store?" he asked himself.

Indeed it was, and that was where his legs were taking him this time. John didn't have much experience with jewelry stores, as only his mom went there, and he usually didn't. However, he would get a first-hand view now.

"Wow, everything is shiny." he said in awe as he walked in and looked around. The little odd 10-year old began walking around, seeing for anything of interesting.
11111111121211111111.title: His legs carried him to another store.

choices: He needed to use the bathroom
111111111212111111111.content:
John looked around the store, observing several of the different items. "They're all so beautiful…" he thought, "Wait… that's not right… They're just really… shiny…"

John's head was still spinning from the other stores he'd visited, so he didn't question it much as he picked out several things. He chose a couple of bracelets, a necklace, and a pair of earrings. After paying for them, he put them on, one by one.

As he slipped on the bracelets, he felt his arms get longer, as well as his legs and torso to match. Then he put the earrings in, despite his ears not being pierced, which took care of itself as he did so. His face also began to morph, his lips puffing out, his cheekbones rising, and his other features changing as well. Finally, he put on the necklace, which didn't appear to do anything at first.

John thanked the man behind the desk as he left the store. Immediately he stopped, shocked by his voice. "What's going on with me?!" He wondered to himself.

Just then…
111111111212111111111.title: Beginning to look the part

1111111112121111111111.content:
As John began to wonder about his throat, he heard his stomach rumble.

"Oops, guess I'm hungry." said John.

As he said that, he clearly heard what his voice sounded like. It was higher now, and sounded very mature. Kind of like his mom.

"Why do I sound like mom?" he asked himself.

However, he didn't get much time to think about it, as his legs were already walking towards the food court. His body looked very natural now, beginning to have the appearance of an adult woman. On the inside, John was feeling afraid. This was all so confusing, yet a part of him liked it. He didn't know what to do.

"What am I supposed to think?" he asked himself as he walked into the food court. He walked up to a nearby restaurant, where he would normally get a burger or something.

"I'll have one of your chicken sandwiches please." asked John when he got to the register.

Soon enough, his little order was finished, and he took it to a nearby table. As he sat down, he crossed his legs like any woman would, completely feeling normal about it.

"This is so wierd." he said as he began to eat.
1111111112121111111111.title: He began to get hungry

11111111121211111111111.content:
As he ate John began to get a stomach ache. He groaned as he put his hands to his belly, hoping it would go away. However, it only got worse and worse until his stomach completely caved in, completing his new curvy hourglass figure. After this, the pain subsided and he was able to finish his meal.

As he finished, John stood up and decided to make his way toward his next destination, wherever that may be. As he walked, he really noticed how different his body felt. It was like he was becoming a completely different person, who was a lot like his mom. He had no idea what he was going to tell her later on…

He kept moving, observing the different stores. He passed right by the video game store without a second thought. However, he stopped inside the bookstore for a minute or two before picking something out and leaving. He looked through it a bit, realizing that he had no idea what half of the words meant, yet he was able to read and understand it anyway.

He made a few more purchases here and there, finally stopping at…
11111111121211111111111.title: Another strange feeling

111111111212111111111111.content:
Finally, at long last, John appeared at the exit to the store.

"Am I finally done here?" he asked himself. He looked at the bags in his arms, filled with new purchases. Something in his mind said that he was done here.

With that finalyl decided, he walked out of the store, high heels clacking against the pavement. More and more, he felt like he was becoming someone new, although his still 10-year old brain couldn't really understand anything.

Before long, he was finally at the car, where he put his purchases in the passenger seat. As he sat down, he noticed how comfy the seat was now, going against his inflated behind. As he looked around, the car felt normal now, like it was the same size on the inside as the outside now, different from how he felt before.

"Wierd." he said.

As if on auto-pilot, he started the car and was on his way. He really wanted to get home. He really wanted to ask his mom what was happening to him, and if she could help.

"Gotta find mom. Quickly." he said as he was soon on the highway.

Despite being slight panicked, his driving was rather calm, as one would expect. More and more, he seemed to relax a bit, enjoying the ride to wherever he was going.
111111111212111111111111.title: The exit

1111111112121111111111111.content:
Driving was beginning to feel more and more natural to John each time he did it. In fact, at this point if was as if he had been doing it for years. His muscles knew exactly what to do, but his brain couldn't comprehend any of it. Instead, he just relaxed as he drove along, back to his "mom's" house.

As he pulled up in front, he grabbed his things and headed inside. "Oh hi! I didn't know you were coming back over!" Ellen said, seeming surprised to see him.

"Hi…" said John, once again confused out of his mind by his mother's actions.

"What does she mean by that?! Did she think I was just going to leave and not—" John stopped short as he reached where his room had been, finding that it had been replaced by a small office.

John nearly screamed as he stared at the room. "Is something wrong?" asked Ellen, noticing him just standing there in front of the doorway.

"What happened to my room?!" ask John in a panic.

"That old place? You never noticed? Well, it's been years since we were roommates you know, and with you moving out to go live with your new husband and all, I figured it was time to give this old room a new purpose. I had no idea you'd be so upset!"

John couldn't believe his ears. What was she talking about? What's a "roommate"? He was married?! He looked down at the ring on his finger and remembered the events from earlier that day.

"No, it's… fine…" said John through his confusion. He really just needed to sit down and think. None of this could possibly be real! He had lived in that room all his life! Or had he…? The memories began to intertwine in his mind until he wasn't sure what was real and what wasn't. However, one thing was clear: he needed to find a place to rest and be done with this insane day. Maybe things would be clearer in the morning.

"I'm… sorry, but I think I should go now…" said John, or at least, some part of him.

"I understand. It is getting late, and I'm sure your husband would want you to be back before dark."

"Bye…" said John as he carried his things back to his car. However, just before he left, he realized that he needed to use the bathroom. He went back inside and quickly found one.

Without thinking, he pulled down his clothes and sat down, even though he normally stood up. As he pulled them back up, he failed to notice something was missing down there…

"Okay, I'm going for real now…" she said.
1111111112121111111111111.title: To Ellen's house

11111111121211111111111111.content:
As if still on autopilot, John went to the bathroom, using the toilet like the woman she was now.

"This is so wierd." John said to herself as she did her business.

Before too long, she was done and washing her hands after wiping up, another odd feeling. She finished up and walked downstairs, where Ellen was.

"Are you feeling better?" asked Ellen.

"Y-Yeah." said John slowly.

"Oh good. Well, get home safely. I hope to see you tomorrow." said Ellen with a smile.

"Yes, me too." said John, not knowing what to do.

After putting her high heels back on, John walked outside with her stuff and got back into her car. Unknowingly, she was exactly what a real woman was now, and John's head was starting to feel woozy from the toll it was having on her mind.

"Ugh, what a headache. When will this nightmare end? Why doesn't mom know me?" John asked herself in exasperation as she got the car started and out of the driveway.
11111111121211111111111111.title: On the way…

He sat at a table near the fountain at the center, legs crossed like he always crossed them. He noticed every time an older guy walked by - older like his brother Tom in college - they stared at him for a weirdly long time, eyes pointed right between his legs. It then crossed his mind that his friends always laughed when a girl at school did the same thing, though John didn't get the point of it. They just showed their underwear and it was kind of embarrassing but not more special than when boys showed their underwear, not as special as boobs or anything. Still, he put his legs down and pushed the skirt so nobody but the ants on the ground could see up his skirt, and they didn't matter.

Then he heard a voice he'd known since he was a baby yell, "CHELSEA!" and turning his head he saw Mom running across the food court, past Taco Bell and Sbarro's, straight toward him. My name is Chelsea, John thought; he blanched inside. That's a really girly name!

"Oh, Chelsea, how are you?" she asked, extending her arms for a hug. This was a grown-up hug, short, kind of awkward, and it didn't mean as much as the hugs Mom gave John to say she loved him, so John tried to keep that in mind when he got up and returned it. He threw in a pat on Mom's shoulder because it felt right.

"I'm doing good," he said, pretending his voice didn't sound so weird and high, but also thicker. "I'm hanging out. At the food court."

"It was a long day at the office. So many documents..." Mom wiped an imaginary sweat drop from her head. "I hope this transaction goes through soon."

The word "transaction" didn't mean a thing to John, but he inferred correctly that his mom and Chelsea worked at the same place, and his mom was a lawyer so Chelsea must be a lawyer too. This was a start.

"Look, Chelsea..." His mom kept looking over her shoulder and walking in place. "I'm looking for John right now. I don't know where he went. We were by Sears when I looked around and he just... disappeared! The bastard can run so fast. Did you see him anywhere?"
11112121.title: Mom and son, office coworkers

choices: Mom doesn't believe him; takes "Chelsea" away to calm down
Mom believes him; goes to confront the store owner
111121211.content:
After getting over the shock of hearing Mom use a dirty word (and aimed at him!) John saw his chance. His mom was aware that he had gone missing, she was probably suspecting the worst, and to top it all off John was now her co-worker and (best?) friend Chelsea, a mature lady she trusted as an equal. If Chelsea confessed she was actually a ten-year old boy transformed by a magic clothing store, who wouldn't believe her?

"Mom? Uh, I mean. Re... Ra, Ro" John tried to remember what his dad called Mom when they thought John wasn't around. The only words that came to mind were "Sexy" and "Mrs. Bitch," which he heard through their bedroom door some nights after midnight. His mom cocked her head and eyed him curiously. Whatever, he thought; he'd just go through with it. "Forget about it! Mom, look: you think I'm Chelsea because I'm in Chelsea's skin and clothes and everything about me is like Chelsea."

"What are you talking about?" Mom said.

"You want John, but... I'm John!" John said this louder than intended and a few heads turned. Mom seemed uncomfortable with the attention, but John kept going: "While we were at Sears, I got bored so I went away and found a clothing store. I went inside the clothing store and suddenly I'm wearing these clothes and I've got Chelsea's..." He gestured at his chest, resisting the word choice, trying to find a more appropriate fit. "...lumps! I asked the lady at the counter to change me back but she said I had to go to Chelsea's job and live with her husband and raise her kids. I don't want to raise any kids! I'm just ten years old!"
111121211.title: He tries to tell his mom the truth

1111212112.content:
"Chelsea's" usually calm, fuzzy voice spiked and cracked in ways Ellen Breicht heard more often from her son John on Saturday mornings as he rushed to watch that new Chinese cartoon, Yi-Go-something or other. Ellen could feel her cheeks redden the more people looked over at this grown woman ranting across from her. Her gut told her to obey her embarrassment; Chelsea was acting incredibly insane and silly; she just needed to lie down somewhere before she went home, and maybe then her husband Mark could take her to the doctor's. The issue of Chelsea claiming to be John entered nowhere in the equation.

But Ellen knew her son's tone, inflection, language and demeanor, all captured perfectly now on the face and gestures and in the voice of her best friend Chelsea Whitaker. She had known Chelsea since their second year of college and she had never expressed an interest in acting. It was counter to her whole nature to impersonate a ten-year-old boy, her friend and co-worker's son, or anybody. And she did refer to plenty of specifics about that morning...

Ellen tried one last time: "Chelsea, if you're fucking with me--"

"I'm not fuck, uuuhh..." Chelsea stammered. "Uh, you don't want me to use that word, right? Even though I'm grown-up now?"

The dam holding back the water of belief shattered with one strike. Nobody but her son, a real little kid, would treat profanity so sacredly. She hugged her friend and whispered, "Oh, John!" over and over, hardly understanding the circumstances but knowing something incredibly strange had happened to lead them here. Memories of her teenage years, when she went through a Wiccan phase and called herself "nature's sorceress" rushed back. Guess magic wasn't so strange after all...

"Mom!" John grumbled between kisses. "You're embarrassing us!"

Ellen held her son at arm's distance, staring him straight in the eye. "John," she began, more sternly, "You said a clothing store did this to you."

"Yeah..." John said. "I forgot the name. It was on the first floor, though! It had a sweater and jeans on the sign above the door with sparkles around them; I think it was next to the bookstore?"

Ellen ran through her mental map of the Ellison Outdoor Mall and pinpointed the area where the store should be. Frankly, she didn't know the name of the store either or whether she had seen it any other time beside that day. Se led John out of the food court, by hand at first until she remembered he was an adult now - albeit one tripping on her heels every other step. She hoped the store was there like John said so she could crack this mystery and give her son back his body. And whoever that store attendant was who told John to live Chelsea's life, they were going to have a few words, or more...
1111212112.title: Mom takes charge

choices: She points out John's old clothes, now hanging on one of the sales racks.
She trips Ellen, who falls backwards into a rack of clothing and changes!
11112121121.content:
“There it is, Mom!” sobbed the adult body of Chelsea, pointing at a nondescript clothing store in the distance.

“Compose yourself,” whispered Ellen. “I know you're my ten-year old son, but the rest of the world sees a grown woman crying and making a spectacle of herself.”

John took a deep breath to calm down. As he breathed in, he watched hypnotically as his giant, new breasts heaved and jiggled a bit, in spite of the lacy, lilac restraint he wore beneath his crisp white blouse.

“And don't stare at yourself,” Ellen whispered gently.

John blushed and looked away from his cleavage.

Hand in hand, the two grown woman walked into the store, Ellen in the lead, almost dragging the reluctantly fearful body of her friend Chelsea behind.

“Don't touch anything here, Mom,” warned John. “That's all I did, was just brush against these clothes and I got all changed.”

Ellen nodded silently at her son. But her focus wasn't on the endless racks of clothing in the store. She was searching for the store attendant her son had described. The one who had told John to go live Chelsea's life, work at her job, raise her kids, and have dinner with her husband. Where was this woman, fumed Ellen.

“May I help you ladies?” said a gentle voice from directly behind Ellen.

Ellen and John whirled around and came face to face with a smiling woman with long, brown hair.

“My son isn't a lady, and I think you know it!” growled Ellen.

“Oh, I think I understand why you're here, ma'am,” grinned the sales associate.

“I think you'd better change John back into himself right this minute,” fumed Ellen.

“That's not quite how things work here, ma'am,” said the attendant. “But never fear: we can definitely work out something for the both of you.”

"Nah, just kidding. Here you go." The attendant took John's old clothes off of one of the racks. "So, you could have changed him back this whole time?!" Ellen shouted. "Yes. We like to have a little fun around here." The attendant gave an evil smirk. "Well don't do it again!" Ellen told the assistant. as John touched his old clothes, but nothing happened. "They won't work until 24 hours after the transformation. I suggest you just buy them and wait for tomorrow." John then gave the assistant another hundred dollars, as she gave him his change. "Mom, let's just get out of here before another transformation happens..." John mumbled. "We'll be off, then." Ellen said. "And don't 'have a little fun' with my family again!" she shouted. "Okay, I won't. but feel free to come back any time." Ellen and John simply walked out of the store and got into the car.

"Also, I suggest you use a tissue to clean your nose this time instead of wiping your 'gold' on the car seat. It's really hard to clean out, you know." Ellen told John in the middle of the trip home, passing him a box of tissues. "If you don't, I might just keep you as Chelsea forever!" John looked at the seat next to him. It already had a few of Chelsea's boogers on it that he picked, and he hurt his nose a few times with Chelsea's fingernails. He had tried to pick the lunulas off, but they were too strong. Plus, his mother would never keep him as Chelsea forever, but John didn't know that. "Okay, mom..." "Good. Put the used ones in the plastic bag." "John, come here for a second." "Coming." John rushed downstairs, breasts bouncing thanks to the lack of a bra. "Talk to Chelsea on the phone. Hearing her own voice should convince her." "Kay." Ellen put the phone on speaker and put it down on the table. "Chelsea, this is John-” There was a sudden gasp at the other end. "Holy shit, you're not kidding!" "Chelsea, don’t swear to John He's only ten.” “Sorry, sorry. Anyway, John, I’m not sure if you want to do this, but seeing as you’re me right now, I’m sick at the moment and can't come to me and Ellen’s-um, your mom’s job tomorrow. Would you mind being me for an extra day and come to our office? You don’t have to, but I was hoping you’d do it. Your mom will explain everything about it if you do.” After thinking about it, John decided to...

Bye!” Chelsea hung up. “Well, that means you have the rest of the day and all of tomorrow off.” Ellen said, as another phone call happened. “Hello?” “Also, we can custom make our own clothes, so you can be a person that doesn’t exist and that way you can’t run into anybody who would recognize your body.” Ellen immediately recognized the attendant’s voice. “Would you like one for you, or one for your friend-er, son?” Ellen got angry, remembering what happened earlier. “No! I don’t want one!” “What about your son? In a year or two when hormones kick in, he’ll be thankful for this.” Ellen sighed. “Okay, I’ll put you on with John.” “It’s the lady from the store, right?” John guessed. “Yup”, Ellen said. As the attendant explained the custom outfits, John decided...

After about 30 minutes and some help due to the whole scenario of being a woman and the skirt and the ‘lumps’, John was dressed in a red and black dress, some black underwear and some black flats [i think it should be obvious why]. “Okay, let’s go!” Ellen shouted as they both got into the car. “You know, I think we might be going to this store a lot. At first I thought it was bad, but now… not so much.” “I like it too, but let’s just get there.” John said, eager to get another body to use. Ellen looked at John and said...
111121211211112.title: Female

111121211212.content:
"Perhaps you might be interested in a similar product?" the attendant proffered, inching invisibly closer to Ellen and her son-turned-coworker. Neither noticed. "We have many other outfits suited to your day-to-day life. Your friend's lovely dress is only the tip of the iceberg."

"He is not just a friend," Ellen snarled. "He is my son and he deserves his life back!"

Forgetting John's warning, Ellen reached her hand out to grasp the attendant's shoulder. The intention, as far as she figured it in that split-second, was to bring the woman close and sock her on the teeth with Ellen's leather purse, hopefully shattering a few teeth on the hard, plastic buttons lining the flap. Instead, the attendant stuck out her foot and nudged Ellen off balance with the tip of her heel. Already off-kilter with one arm forward and her leg suddenly airborne, Ellen couldn't right herself in time to avoid tumbling backwards, directly into a clothing rack and the outfit hanging nearest her. John watched with slack-jawed panic as his mom transformed upon touching...
111121211212.title: Like Mother, like Son (and Worse!)

choices: Ellen and John try to go back to their old bodies' house
Chelsea's husband sees them, takes them to their new home
1111212112121.content:
Ellen hit the tile as the transformation kicked into full gear, and she only noticed the tightness around her torso, from her crotch to her neck and arms, after the pain cleared across her back. She recovered her breath in time to notice the ceiling had grown half a story and her arms no longer reached across the foot of the rack but only halfway, and both were bare up to her shoulders where nylon and spandex dug into softer, pudgier skin uninterrupted by the artist's touch of female puberty. Her body had compressed, squished, and bundled itself without fanfare. She registered something was amiss when she tried to stand and couldn't, her feet were too small and alien for such a motion. Then she heard the wheezing in her breath, the square chest rising and falling without the familiar lumps extending their reach.

Two shadows fell over her and blended together. One jumped from foot to foot in childish agitation. The other hovered motionless like a sleek totem pole.

"Since you're a regular customer," the totem pole shadow said to the writhing shadow, "your daughter can keep the swimsuit. It's a lovely day for the pool, after all."

"Daughter!?" Ellen squeaked with Minnie Mouse's vocal chords. Of course, she thought in hindsight. Isn't it obvious?

The store attendant bent down, out of the ceiling lights that blacked out her features and into focus. To the new Ellen, 3'9'', she seemed enormous. Ellen winced as the attendant pawed at her new pigtails, shorter than a barber's brush for sweeping off stray hair, and squealed when she picked her up. The ground fell away with startling ease; momentum swung Ellen forward until she was passed to John - her own son! two feet taller! - and he plopped her down immediately upon grabbing her. The reality of the transformation sank in once Ellen was standing, blood rushing through her body faster now that she was shorter. She also caught a quick peek of her reflection in a mirror: slight chipmunk cheeks with freckles, complementary red hair like a fireball, and a figure that promised after a few more years to blossom into adolescent beauty.

"You make an adorable pair," the attendant cooed. She bent down to stare Ellen in the eye. "I'm sure you'll look just like your mother when you grow up."

With those words she flicked her eyes from Ellen to John, as if to say, "Remember who he is now," and turned to strut back to the counter. Ellen wanted to run after and claw her backside but she felt a hand yank her forward, out the front door of the store, and suddenly she stood in the open-air mall suffocating on an expanse she hadn't experienced since she was eight-years-old. The sky was higher, the mall stores spaced more widely. John towered next to her holding his mom's hand, unsure how to treat a woman who was supposed to be his caretaker but now wore a kid's sized Hello Kitty swimsuit. What had happened to avenging her son and reclaiming their life? Now they were a completely different mother-and-child, of mixed genders, ages, roles, everything, and the day was just beginning.
1111212112121.title: Second childhood

choices: They go to Ellen's old car
11112121121211.content:
"Why did you drag me out of there?" Ellen snapped with a helium voice. She crossed her arms and glared at John in the most adorable impression of a mother getting angry. "We have twice the score to settle now!"

"It's no use!" John said dejectedly. "You're a girl and I'm a lady, and you're my daughter now, I think? I don't know! I don't want us changing any more!"

He threw his arms in the air, and Ellen saw, with the rest of the mall's shoppers walking around them, how hopeless her son looked, even with the assured, stony features of Chelsea's face. Her rage subsided and Ellen wished she could hug all of John, instead of just his waist where she now stared at. It would be odd providing her son with motherly advice in these bodies but she had to do her best, no matter what the store attendant expected of them.

"It's okay," she said. "It's probably a good thing we don't try anything rash anymore. We just have to accept who we are... you're Chelsea, 35-years old, a grown woman, and I'm Melanie, your 8-year old daughter. We'll be like that for at a least a little while longer."

"Is a little while longer really long?" John asked.

Ellen stifled a giggle at her son's dopey words, even as his shadow enveloped all of her. How funny to be talking in a girl's voice but lecturing like a mother, while the actual (in appearance) mother gapes, asks naive questions, and picks her nose.

"It shouldn't be," Ellen assured him, resisting the urge to add "Hopefully." "Here! Why don't we go back home. Maybe we have new bodies but live in the same building, and you're a new Chelsea who can stay home and play video games all day while I'm the eight-year old girl who works in an office!" The attempt at a joke didn't resonate in her new, pipsqueak voice, and she was starting to shiver from the wind gusting across her bare feet, legs and arms. The elastic bands on the swimsuit dug in painfully, and if she didn't get another layer of clothes she might be blown away. "Let's go," she finished lamely, extending her hand so John could take it and maintain the illusion of his authority. Together, they waddled with discomfort across the plaza toward the mall exit.
11112121121211.title: Back to where they once belonged

choices: They get home and find Chelsea and Melanie trapped in their old bodies.
They get home and find a strange, weird, new reality shift has altered history.
111121211212111.content:
The mismatched mother-and-child pair walked in a quiet daze through the parking lot for a long, uncomfortable period of silence.

“Mom?” asked John nervously.

“I think that's your job now,” squeaked Ellen in her eight-year old voice.

“I don't wanna be the mom,” said John tearfully.

“You saw what happened when we went back into that store,” Ellen said. “Tell me honestly, John: do you think it would be a good idea to charge back in there as unsatisfied customers and demand a refund?”

John shook his head silently.

“We'll just have to think of something else,” Ellen said. “And in the meantime, you're … you're my mom, I guess. Try to remember your real name is Chelsea, but I'll call you … I'll call you 'mommy' okay?”

John giggled at the thought of his grown mother calling him mommy!

“Now Chelsea's little girl is named Melanie,” continued Ellen. “So you should probably call me that, or Mel for short.”

“Okay mom … I mean Melanie,” John said uncomfortably.

“What do we do now?” John asked, bending down to speak face to face with his mother. “I mean, where do we go 'n stuff? You really think we have new lives back home? Cuz I just don't wanna be somebody's wife!”

“Easy, calm down,” Ellen said soothingly. “We don't know anything about anything yet. Don't cry, honey … uh, mommy, I mean.”

“I'll try,” sniffed John.

“Let's just start by going back to our own home,” Ellen said. “Perhaps we can explain things to your father, and then maybe he could help think up a suggestion to undo this mess. And maybe we really do have weird new lives where I work for a living and you're a stay-at-home lady who plays video games!”

“I doubt it. I mean, what if we get back to our house and we find the real Chelsea and Melanie are in our bodies just like we're stuck in theirs?” asked John, starting to get hysterical again.

“Calm down. You know, that might be good,” said Ellen, forcing a smile. “We could all put our heads together and think up some way to reverse these bodyswaps. Now let's get in the car, honey. Uh, you know you'll have to drive now.”

“I can't drive!” John exclaimed, his panicked face turning ghostly white.

“I'll walk you through it,” Ellen said soothingly. “But there's no way I'll be able to drive, honey. In fact, I'll probably have to sit in a booster seat in the back. Come on, John: don't cry! You've played so many video games, I know you'll pick up the actual skill of driving in no time at all. It'll be fun, honey! You're finally getting to drive a real car.”

“I'll try,” John said with a sniff. He wiped his nose with the back of his hand in a decidedly unladylike fashion that Ellen chose to ignore for the moment.
111121211212111.title: You can't go home again -- can you?

They head immediately to the pool
11112121121212.content:
"That bitch!" Ellen yowled loud and at the height of her octave range. The plaza ground to a halt to see if this foul-mouth grade schooler's mother would reprimand her, but John only returned the gazes like a deer in headlights trying to assure the car they would both be all right and no point worrying about collision. Ellen nearly embarked on a longer tirade but the morning chill snapped her to her senses. She was an eight-year old girl now, Chelsea Whittaker's daughter Melanie to be precise. She had no problem with Melanie or anything about her, but it was certainly no existence for a woman who had painstakingly built her life, career, and family nearly from scratch, and now they had to figure out how to return to their old bodies without bumping shoulders (and heels) with Mrs. Life Destroyer inside. Not much she could do currently in a constricting one-piece colored with pictures of Pooh Bear...

Then, before she could turn to John and find the right calming words, uninhibited by the body and voice delivering them, a pleasant voice yelled, "Chelsea! Melanie!" from their left. Ellen was the first to turn. Her son took a second to respond to his new name.

Chelsea's husband Miles, with his squat body, stocky arms, and bread-loaf cheeks clean of facial hair, advanced toward them in a suit he fancied as "casual" although it singled him out in tight crowds of a thousand. His fuzz-brown jacket awkwardly reflected the sunlight and threatened to slide down his shoulders and off his body from being two sizes too big. He squeaked with each step as his hand-me-down loafers decompressed from all the rain, wear, and chewing dogs they had endured, and closer up the amount of grease used to pat down his hair and hide his bald spot struck John and Ellen with rancid pungency.

"How are you doing, ladies?" He bent to kiss Ellen on the cheek, and then got up face-to-face with John. Miles dove into John's lips, too quickly for him to dodge or react, seizing them with a wet kiss meant to suggest they had business to attend later that night, when the kid was tucked in bed and asleep. He pulled away leaving John on the verge of tears. "You had a good shopping day. That's a lovely swimsuit. We'll have to hit the pool when we get back!"

John didn't say anything, so Ellen nudged her lightly in the leg. It didn't send the appropriate message.

"Well, sweetie," Miles continued. "Are you guys ready to go? I don't want my day off work to go to waste."

"Urm... Ahh..." was all came out of John's mouth.

"Yeah!" Ellen chirped, horrified at the act she now had to pull. She lifted her voice artificially and forced a grotesque, cheery-as-torture smile toward the man she still considered her best friend's husband. "I'm ready, Dad!"

Miles chuckled. "Okay, Mel. I'm glad you're ready. Hopefully we can still find the car..."

The loafers squished away as he returned the way he came. John and Ellen only shared a brief, concerned look, with Ellen communicating through gesture that they'd discuss this later, and hesitantly followed, Ellen stopping and wincing when her bare feet dug into the pocked, pebbly sidewalk, John teetering on his heels like a drunk.
11112121121212.title: Husband of a Boy and the Father of a Woman

choices: At home, John's husband is hovering and overprotective of his wife's health.
At home, John and Ellen get a private moment to put together a plan.
111121211212121.content:
“Well come on and let's go home!” said Miles in a friendly, happy booming voice. The man was blissfully ignorant of the true, mistaken identities of his wife and daughter.

He bent over and gave John a quick peck on the lips, then began leading the family back to the car.

John was too shocked to say or do anything.

“You okay, babe?” Miles asked John.

Ellen decided she'd better take the lead again. Nudging John until he glanced downward at her, Ellen then winked at her son before speaking.

“Say, daddy!” Ellen said, giving the strange man a hug. “Mommy and I missed you. We had lots of fun shopping, but Mommy doesn't feel well now. She'd like to go home and rest.”

“Chelsea, are you okay?” Miles said with a concerned expression.

“I'm fine,” John said with a shrug.

Ellen nudged him again.

“I mean, I'm not fine,” John said, correcting himself. “I got a cold. I wanna just go home and lay down.”

“You don't sound like yourself,” said John's new husband sympathetically. “Come on and let's get the two of you back home. Chelsea, you look white as a sheet, too! Would you like me to make an appointment at the clinic for you?”

“Sure, okay, I guess,” John said.

“Mommy just needs some quiet rest,” said Ellen. “Isn't that what you said, mommy? Not a doctor's visit, but just some quiet rest time?”

“Yeah, I just want that,” John mumbled. “I just wanna go home.”

“Get in the car everybody,” said John's husband. “I'm sure we'll all feel a lot better once we get back home. We can all hit the pool together later. I'm sure Melanie won't mind waiting to show off her new swimsuit a bit. Just until mommy's feeling better, right darling?”

“Uh, right … daddy!” Ellen forced herself to say.

The two of them climbed into the car and allowed Miles Whittaker to drive them off to a strange, unfamiliar destination: their own home!

1111212112122.content:
Ellen flew backwards, tumbling into a rack of men's athletic wear.

The transformation was instantaneous.

By the time Ellen actually landed on the floor, the muscles of her arms and legs were already bursting forth into monstrously large bulges. Her breasts had been swallowed up in the firm, manly pectoral muscles of a weightlifter's chest. Her legs were veritable tree trunks of muscular flesh now. Her head was shaved bald, but a deep forest of dark, gray stubble grew across her cheeks and hard, chiseled chin now.

She landed with a surprisingly athletic roll – more of a carefully performed tumble than a fall.

Springing energetically to her feet, Ellen discovered she was now clothed in nothing but a pair of men's gym shorts, a pair of white tube socks, and some men's running shoes.

“What did you just do to me?” she growled in a deep, gravelly voice.

For the first time, the store attendant actually looked nervous.

“Uh … hello there, sir,” she said softly. “Can I, uh, help you find something?”

“Change me and my son back to normal!” Ellen roared, baring her chest and clenching her fists like a male gorilla defending its territory in the jungle.

“I, uh, you see, I don't have authority to, uh, I'd have to ask my manager, and …” stuttered the clerk.
1111212112122.title: Ellen becomes Mr. Universe

11112121122.content:
Ellen Breicht searched frantically through the mall, tugging an oddly reluctant Chelsea along by the hand, as though the woman were really a sullen, truculent child … which, of course, she was!

Chelsea (actually 10-year old John Breicht, now trapped in the body of an adult woman) teetered along behind Ellen, clattering about clumsily in shiny, two inch tall pumps.

“Mom, my feet hurt!” whined John.

“Don't call me Mom right now,” hissed Ellen. “Until we get you back in your own body, it'll just look too strange. Call me Ellen. And please, try to look more ladylike! Chelsea would never slouch like that or stand with her legs apart that wide. You're a grown woman right now.”

“I don't want to me!” cried John.

“I don't want you to be this way either,” sighed Ellen. “But unless we can find that shop, I don't see what alternative we have. You're SURE it was right over here?”

John nodded quietly.

He resisted the urge to pick his nose right now, knowing that under the present circumstances mom would explode at him for such a transgression.

For the next hour, the pair of them continued to comb every corner of the mall, in a vain search for what simply wasn't there: the store had vanished.

“I wasn't lying mom,” sobbed John.

“I believe you,” Ellen said, giving the body of her friend Chelsea a tight hug. “Obviously, you were telling the truth, or else how did this happen?”

“What are we going to do?” asked John.

Again, he tugged at the itchy, stiff fabric of the lacy bra strapped across his heavy, swollen chest.

“I don't like having these,” sighed John.

“Don't touch yourself in public,” whispered Ellen. “Now, just calm down. I'll think of something.”

Ellen struggled to recall her adolescence, dabbling in a bit of neo-pagan Wiccan, nature worship. It was all so long ago and had just been a passing fancy. But here she stood now, with undeniable proof of the very real existence of magic. Surely she could recall something from those far away, rebellious years of non-conforming youth. Wasn't there a spell, an incantation, a ritual, even a song that she could recall that might be of help?
11112121122.title: The store has disappeared

choices: Fast forward somewhere into the year
111121211221.content:
Ellen strained her memory for the smallest lead, even the most fleeting possibility of changing her son back to a son. It was hard to think with Chelsea's almond eyes, thin, brown and piercing, observing her. She expected her friend's body to tease her for treating hippy claptrap like a science; she was a grown woman, for Christ's sake. Then she remembered no matter how mature Chelsea appeared at a passing glance, she was still in reality a ten-year old resisting the urge to fondle himself in public, and this reassured her.

"Mom...?" John started, afraid his mother had shut down like a computer.

That's when she remembered. "I got it!" she yelled, louder than anticipated. John gave a cartoony "Whoa!" and stumbled back, but he was eagerly listening. "When I was in high school, my friends and I danced in the forest whenever there was a full moon," Ellen said, waving her arms with exuberance she forgot she had. "We sang songs and wore silly clothes, but one of my friends Charity always said that if you danced underneath a blue moon - that's the second full moon in one month." She made sure John followed her. "If you dance beneath a blue moon and sing a certain song and you're by a body of water in a forest then your true self will be revealed."

It occurred to Ellen after she stopped talking how ridiculous this sounded. It was a lead, though.

John was beaming. "All right! So when's the next blue moon?"

Ellen calculated the last time she saw a blue moon, about how many years passed between them, and where that would place the next one... The answer dampened her spirits. "In about a year."

John's smile faded. His breasts and feathered hair grew heavier in his mind as he calculated with boyish exaggeration how many minutes of female existence a year translated into. He really, really wanted to throw a tantrum. "Moooommm-!" he whined, half a step away from pouting.

"Don't act like a kid!" Ellen said. "If I think of anything else, I'll tell you, but that's the best bet right now. In the meantime..." She searched her mind. Maybe another idea would come, but nothing sparked her inspiration. "We just have to wait."
111121211221.title: Stroke of Pagan genius

choices: John's body and Chelsea's personality simply no longer exist anywhere now.
Chelsea is at Ellen's house, trapped in John's body at the moment.
1111212112211.content:
“But mom!” wailed John, fidgeting nervously with the hem of his skirt. “I can't pretend to be your friend Chelsea for a year!”

“I know, John, but we don't really have a choice in this matter,” Ellen said sympathetically. “Even once we hit the blue moon, there's no guarantee this ritual is going to work – but it's our best shot.”

“So what do I do until then?” John said, shrugging his shoulders and resisting the urge to pick his nose.

“Well, you're going to have to move into Chelsea Whittaker's house,” Ellen said soberly. “Your husband is a man named Miles. You have an eight year old daughter named Melanie. You work with me at the office, so we'll get to see each other every day. You're a lawyer now. Don't worry; I'll help you out at work, honey. But at the Whittaker's home, you'll be on your own.”

“What about your friend Chelsea?” John asked.

“Uh, sweetie, that's you now,” Ellen said delicately.

“No, mom! That's not what I meant,” John said impatiently, stamping his heeled foot on the pavement childishly. “I mean the old Chelsea – the real one! What happened to her? Did she just vanish or something? Is she out there somewhere, stuck in my old body? Is she still at her house like everything is normal, and when I show up she's gonna think I'm an imposter?”

Ellen frowned nervously. She hadn't considered any of these possibilities. It was bad enough her son had to spend the next twelve months as a grown woman … but what if the real Chelsea was now running around in John's ten-year old body? Or worse, what if Chelsea simply no longer existed at all? How was Ellen going to explain the disappearance of her son?

“Mom?” pleaded John. “What do you think happened to your friend when I changed into her?”

“I don't know,” whispered Ellen. “But maybe we'd better try to find out.”

Then we can try the Blue Moon Ritual to change things back. Now be quiet for a moment, sweetie. I'm going to call your father at home.”

She hoped and prayed to find the real Chelsea was now her son. It would make training John to be an adult woman for the next 365 days so much easier, having the original archetype of John's new life available.

Finally, Ellen's husband answered the phone. She immediately asked about their son, and heard her husband reply …

1112.content:
John idly brushed his fingers against the soft, smooth fabric of a cheerleader's uniform, then continued to walk along the store aisles.

Putting his hand to his head, John experienced a fleeting moment of faintness – a lightheaded sensation of whirling that lasted for such a second or two, and then passed.

“Weird,” he said to himself.

And instantly he realized something had changed.

His voice was deeper. Not higher pitched, just richer and more melodic. Somehow a tiny bit more mature.

John looked down at himself and recognized the reason: he was now in the body of a teenage girl!

Dressed in the very same red and white cheerleading uniform he had just touched, John now had thin yet athletic looking arms and legs, smooth and tanned. Small, perky mounds of feminine flesh pushed upward on his chest, straining a little against the sleeveless uniform shell he wore. Alternating pleats of red and white fluttered about the short skirt he wore. Small white socks that looked decidedly girly were now on his feet, rising to just below the level of his ankles. John's shoes looked like normal, white tennis shoes, but felt extra soft and supple, as though they were especially designed for cheerleading girls to jump about and do gymnastic routines in them.

“I'm a girl,” John whispered aloud, running his hands along his slim, new, petite frame in wonder.

“May I be of assistance?” said an approaching sales associate. She was a pretty, brunette in a green dress.

“What's happening to me?” John asked the sales attendant, trying not to betray in his voice the rising panic he now felt.

“Do you like what you see, miss?” asked the sales associate calmly. “That's a healthy, vivacious young body. Very athletic and full of life. A good, energetic form. Bodies like that one usually go quick! You're lucky to have picked it up when you did. Shall I ring you up at the cash register?”

“What? No! I don't understand this,” John cried. “My name is John, and I'm ten years old. I'm not a girl, and I'm not a cheerleader, and I don't want to be this lady! Change me back, please!”

“Another spontaneous conversion?” sighed the sales girl. “That's the third one this week! I do wish you customers would be more careful. We have signs clearly posted at all the entrances.”

“I didn't see anything,” wailed John. “Please, just make me a kid again, and a boy!”

“Let me explain what's happened,” the attendant said gently. “The clothes in this store are magic. When you touch an outfit, the clothes alter you to fit them. You can become an entirely new person, and change your body to suit any style that catches your fancy.

“But this is just an accident,” sobbed John. “I don't want to be a cheerleader.”

“I'm sorry. You should have read the signs and been more careful,” replied the attendant. “You cannot undo the alteration for twenty-four hours. Now if you'll come back and visit us at this time tomorrow, and subsequently touch your old clothing, you may then revert back to the person you were before.”

“My old stuff is here?” asked John.

“Oh, yes,” answered the sales associate. “It will be over in the children's section, among the racks of boys clothes. However, it will disappear if anyone else chooses to touch it. Then, of course, that person would become you, in both body and style.”

“I don't want anyone else buying my body!” whined John.

“It's part of the price of using our service,” explained the attendant. “I'm sorry; I cannot change the rules. I also need to caution you that unless you make another change in the next seven days, reality will be re-written so that you will have always been in this new body and style. But don't worry: I'm sure your old clothes will still be available tomorrow. And even if they aren't, you accidentally selected a wonderful new body. You're a very pretty young lady now, quite healthy looking, and probably an extraordinarily happy and popular girl.”

“I don't want to be a popular girl!” cried John, stomping his dainty, new feet on the floor angrily.

“I really cannot do anything to help you until tomorrow,” replied the sales associate somberly.
1112.title: A cheerleading uniform

11122.content:
John reluctantly looked up to the clock, seeing that it was still midday right now. Today wasn't a school day, hence why he was here in the first place. He hadn't had lunch yet either.

"Well, what am I supposed to do now?" he asked.

"Well, you could pay for the body. Your purse should have money." said the associate.

"Huh?" he asked.

Suddenly, he turned to the side and saw that he had a pink purse on him, with a new name and money and everything. His name was apparently Jenny now, and he had some money and cards. He brought out some bucks and gave them to the girl.

"Thank you. Have a nice day!" smiled the lady.

"Okay...." John said slowly.

So, with his hips swinging side to side, he walked out of the shop, with a perfect female body to boot.

Your family and all your friends only remember Jenny the cheerleader. Now, you seem like a smart kid – you can bluff your way through one day of being an older girl, right?”

111232.title: Beg the clerk for help

choices: On second thought - cheerleader's not so bad after all
1112321.content:
The clerk, Tanya Richardson, had trouble relating to the real-life equivalent of "muggles," humans uninitiated into the selective, esoteric world of witches, sorceresses, warlocks, and wizards, the thousands of cults spread across the globe devoted to training disciples in the art of manipulating stray energy for personal and communal benefit. Recently, a few magic organizations stationed in the American Midwest, including Tanya's own, had the bright idea of teaching the magick-less (their genius moniker for ordinary, untrained people) about the reality of the supernatural. Most members started tarot card and fortune telling businesses, to no avail, but Tanya thought of something more unusual. She wanted to run a clothing store where the clothing shaped the wearer to fit them. It eliminated the pesky business of size, age, and beauty by molding human appearance the variable, where a person could dress as youthfully as they desired. Reality would alter to suit their choice and the world would keep spinning with one new believer in magic. In that regard, John was certainly an initiate, and her main job was done.

But she saw him now, a teenage girl with makeup running, practically on her knees. Infantile, oversensitive, obstinate against all reassurance, Tanya worried John might blow her cover by running her mouth at home, telling "Jenny's" parents about the magic store that gave her these perky breasts and an older female body. Tanya had just left the Order of Shifters with enough knowledge to modify bodies temporarily, alter the reality surrounding them, and attach these energies to inanimate fabric. She did not have the means to relocate her store like the older disciples.

The only option left - and it carried as many risks that threatened her livelihood - only caught her eye because she felt sorry for John, who was so young and oblivious to real magic, not that silly cartoon crap he saw on TV. There had been three spontaneous conversions that week, and the other two had adjusted and changed back... But maybe she deserved to re-compensate John, and maybe take a break from a business that was grating her nerves more and more.

"Listen." Tanya cupped a hand on John's shoulder and looked him in the eye. She smiled like she imagined his mother might. "Here's an option, but it's still a big responsibility, and you have to promise me if you take it that you will do the best you can until you turn back into a boy tomorrow. Is that clear?"

"Y-Yuh..." John sniveled, pulling snot back up her nose in an unladylike manner.

"Do you promise?"

"Yeah. Yeah!" He nodded more vehemently now.

"I can swap bodies with you," Tanya said. "I will take your place as the cheerleader girl and you will be the owner of Flexible Looks Clothing. For the next eight hours, you will run this store, ring people up, and you'll also have the benefit of preventing anyone from touching your old clothes. Mostly, we get two to three people in the store each hour, and most of them leave without touching anything because they realize this isn't Abercrombie. It's not a tough job but you have to stay responsible. After the mall closes you can take a taxi home to the address on my driver's license - that's the card in my purse, behind the counter - and while I live with a boyfriend, he'll understand if you tell him who you are and won't bother you much. If I find out you're messing with my life and not acting like I would, I have the power when I return to punish you. I don't want to, but I think that's only fair considering how generous I'm being. Does that sound reasonable?"
1112321.title: Taking over the store

1113121222.content:
"Ugh."

A small jolt of energy woke up John after his rest. His eyes slowly open, faintly seeing the color of a light brown ceiling. The pain that was hurting him earlier seemed to disappear entirely. What a relief, he thought. His vision slowly becomes clearer after every passing second. On his left side there were blue curtains obstructing the glass window and on his right there was a desk, some chairs, and a mini fridge.

Am I in a hotel? He wondered.

John tried moving his hands around and realized that he can move his body just fine. What he does first is sitting up on the back of the wall because staring at the ceiling directly wasn't a thing he wants to see all day. Simultaneously adjusting his hands and feet, he pushes himself up and successfully makes it. The room now looks much better at this angle.

He looks down to his left where there was a small table carrying a telephone and a lamp. I must be in a hotel, he figures. Was that lady from earlier taking him to this place to heal him? He should be in a hospital instead of a hotel, but he feels better nonetheless.

"Wow this bed is comfy!" John whispers. His sense of attention was focused on the comfortable mattress. He moves his body up and down experiencing the springiness, but after a few seconds there was a heavy feeling on his chest.

Looking down there were two big mounds of flesh right on his body covered by a navy blue fabric. What is this? He thought to himself. Touching one of them with the palm of his hand, he suddenly gets a sensitive reaction for no apparent reason.

Isn't this the bikini? John thought, remembering the one he saw on display at the store. The fabric covering his chest was the same color. Then what am I wearing below?

A white blanket covered lower half of his body and after removing it, there it was: the bikini bottom. Immediately, he realizes that his body was different and stares at his hands and legs seeing that they were not the same. He then feels his face, thinking that there was something different about it too. Sitting down on the bed, he couldn't see for himself if he actually changed.

John escapes the bed and tries to find the bathroom which was conveniently the first door he sees, and inside he comes face to face with his new self on the mirror. Is this me? He wondered.

The reflection showed an adult woman with long hair and a beautiful face while wearing a strapless bikini top and bottom over her curvaceous figure.
1113121222.title: Wakes up on a bed
